concept.title: Changing the Scale of Decimal Fields
concept.shortdesc: You can use the Field Type Converter to change the scale of decimal fields. For example, you might have a decimal field with the value 12345.6789115, and you'd like to decrease the scale to 4 so that the value is 12345.6789.

conbody.p: Field Type Converter processorchanging scaleTo change the scale, you configure the processor to convert decimal fields to the Decimal data type, specifying the scale to use. When you decrease the scale, you can also specify the rounding strategy. For example, you can configure the processor to round up or round down.
You can change the scale of a decimal field by name. Or you can change the scale for all fields with the Decimal data type.
